title: French elections: More than 210 candidates have withdrawn from the second round
summary: Le Monde has counted 218 candidates who have dropped out of the second round, most of them to help beat the far right. This provisional count, based on candidates' statements, is likely to evolve. The final list of candidates will be published on Wednesday.

title: French elections: Far right rules out withdrawing candidates ahead of second round
summary: The Rassemblement National's strategy aims to mock the other blocs' use of candidate withdrawals to prevent the election of far-right MPs. Despite this, the RN is confident that an absolute majority is still within reach.

title: French PM Attal sets aside criticism of left in 'fight' against far right
summary: After his bloc failed in the first round of the parliamentary elections, Gabriel Attal proposed building a new coalition of the right, left and center against the far right, whose rise to power he described as 'chilling.'

title: How Macron is preparing for 'cohabitation' with the far right
summary: Even before the French cast their final votes in the elections, the president began planning in case he has to share power with the Rassemblement National. He is speeding up key appointments while he still has control of the government.

title: Le Pen accuses Macron of 'administrative coup d'état' as he speeds up appointments
summary: The president approved a series of appointments at the last Council of Ministers. The far-right Rassemblement National leader said the move was designed to 'prevent Jordan Bardella from governing the country as he wishes.'

title: 'Inaudible' Macron faces cacophony in his own camp ahead of election's second round
summary: The French president castigated 'any form of disunity' but did not settle disagreements within his coalition on how to best block the far right and what to do after the elections, when he will be deprived of a majority.

title: Yaroslav Nimets, Ukrainian prisoner and volunteer soldier: 'We understand very clearly where we're going'
summary: More than 5,500 detainees have come forward since May 17, when the law allowing prisoners to join the trenches of eastern and southern Ukraine came into force. 'Le Monde' spoke to several of them to find out why.

title: Supreme Court hands Trump big win on presidential immunity
summary: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson, who opposed the decision, accused the Court's conservative majority of planting 'the seeds of absolute power' for presidents. Joe Biden denounced a 'dangerous precedent,' as the threat of a January 6 trial before the November election receded.

title: In Hong Kong, the gradual erosion of the rule of law
summary: The credibility and reputation of Hong Kong's judicial system have been severely shaken by the verdict handed down at the end of May in the historic political trial of the '47.' They have been so much shaken that two British judges sitting on Hong Kong's Court of Final Appeal have announced their resignation, without even waiting for the outcome of the appeal process.

title: Euro 2024: Turkey beats Austria 2-1 to advance to quarterfinal against the Netherlands
summary: Turkish player Merih Demiral opened the scoring after less than a minute on Tuesday and netted again in the second half to set up a clash against the Netherlands in Berlin on Saturday. The Dutch team earlier reached its first European Championship quarterfinal in 16 years with a 3-0 win over Romania.

title: The cheerful campaign of Ed Davey, leader of the UK Liberal Democrats
summary: In a swimsuit in the Thames, on a giant slide or on a roller coaster, the 58-year-old MP has attempted to win over the British public in an offbeat style, ahead of the July 4 general election.

title: Category 5 Hurricane Beryl kills 5, hurtles toward  Jamaica
summary: The storm is causing widespread destruction in a deadly sweep across the southeastern Caribbean.

title: Three dead after Mauritania riots amid post-election tension
summary: Two people died in custody and a third died later in hospital, the government said on Tuesday. The unrest took place against a tense backdrop after final provisional election results announced on Monday gave the incumbent President a comfortable victory in Saturday's presidential poll.

title: Pogacar wins stage four to reclaim Tour de France lead
summary: The two-time former champion soloed to victory in stage four of the cycling race.

title: Hungary's Orbán makes first visit to Ukraine since start of war
summary: The Hungarian prime minister arrived in Kyiv on Tuesday to talk with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, marking his first visit to the wartorn country since the start of Russia's invasion.

title: Dutch king swears in a new government seven months after far right won elections
summary: Dick Schoof, former head of the Dutch intelligence agency and counterterrorism office, is the new prime minister.

title: Nearly 100 killed in stampede at India religious gathering
summary: Crowds had gathered to celebrate the Hindu deity Shiva in the city of Hathras, located some 140 kilometers southeast of New Delhi. Official reports reported the death toll had reached 97 on Tuesday afternoon.

title: Lloyd Doggett becomes first Democratic Congress member to call for Biden to step down as party nominee
summary: Representative Doggett of Texas said in a statement Tuesday that Biden should 'make the painful and difficult decision to withdraw.'

title: Israel frees director of Gaza hospital, sparking internal political backlash
summary: The Palestinian doctor, who said he was subjected to 'severe torture' during his detention, was released after the Shin Bet confirmed that he met the criteria for release. Other sources indicate that the release of dozens of prisoners was due in part to a lack of space in Israeli prisons.
